Sure, here are some age-appropriate book recommendations for young children:

1. Board books: These are books made of thick cardboard that are designed for young children to handle and explore. Some popular board books include "The Very Hungry Caterpillar" by Eric Carle and "Goodnight Moon" by Margaret Wise Brown.

2. Picture books: Picture books are books that tell a story through illustrations and text. Some popular picture books for young children include "Where the Wild Things Are" by Maurice Sendak and "Corduroy" by Don Freeman.

3. Early readers: Early readers are books designed specifically for children who are learning to read. They typically have short sentences and simple vocabulary. Some popular early reader series include "The Berenstain Bears" by Stan and Jan Berenstain and "Pete the Cat" by James Dean.

4. Chapter books: As children progress in their reading skills, they may enjoy longer stories broken into chapters. Some popular chapter book series for young children include "Magic Tree House" by Mary Pope Osborne and "Judy Moody" by Megan McDonald.

Remember, the most important thing is to find books that your child is interested in and to make reading a fun and enjoyable activity for them.
